page.title: 16NATURE
page.content: THE COUNTRYSIDE AROUND US IS VERY NICE. THERE ARE LOTS OF VIEWS AND LAKES, BUT THE LAND IS VERY ROCKY. MOST OF THE FIELDS ARE SLOPING, WHICH MAKES FARMING DIFFICULT. MOST OF THE HOUSES ARE MADE OF STONE. THE VILLAGES AROUND US ARE SMALL. THERE ARE THREE HUNDRED PEOPLE IN GLENRIDDING. SOME OF THE HOUSES ARE HOLIDAY HOUSES. THE MOUTAINS ARE QUITE HIGH AROUND HERE. SOME GO UP TO OVER 3000 FEET LIKE HELVELLYN. THE BIGGEST IS SCAFELL, ALTHOUGH THIS IS SOME WAY AWAY. THE TREES AROUND US ARE NORMALY OAK. THERE ARE NOT MANY FLAT AREAS IN THE DALE .THE ONLY FLAT AREAS ARE IN BETWEEN THE LAKE AND PATTERDALE. THIS IS WHERE THE GOLDRILL BECK HAS BROUGHT DOWN A LOT OF MATERIAL TO THE HEAD OF ULLSWATER. MUCH OF OUR AREA WAS EXTENSIVELY CARVED BY ICE IN THE LAST ICE AGE.
